nz.ac.vuw.ecs.swen225.gp20.recnplay

Class Replayer

  • java.lang.Object
    • nz.ac.vuw.ecs.swen225.gp20.recnplay.Replayer

  • public class Replayer
extends java.lang.Object
    Loads and plays through game replays for Chap's Challenge.
     

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      private class  Replayer.ActionPlayer
      Replay a recorded action from a loaded game by simulating player input in the GUI.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private boolean autoReplaying
      Keeps track of whether the program is auto-replaying through a recorded game, or is going through it step-by-step.
      private double currentTimeInReplay
      The timestamp within a loaded game that this Replayer is currently at.
      static long DEFAULT_DELAY_MILLIS
      The period between two distinct timestamps in a game being replayed when the replay speed is 1.0x (only relevant while in auto-replay mode).
      private java.util.Queue<ActionRecord> gameRecordHistory
      Stores the history of actions done by actors from a loaded game replay.
      private GameGUI gui
      The GUI associated with the game.
      private int level
      The level of the currently loaded game record.
      static java.util.List<java.lang.Double> REPLAY_SPEEDS
      Holds the possible replay speeds that a recorded game can be replayed at.
      private Replayer.ActionPlayer replayedAction
      This object replays actions regularly while replaying in auto-replay mode.
      private double replaySpeed
      The speed at which recorded actions are performed.
      private java.util.Timer timer
      Timer used to perform actions on a regular basis.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Replayer(GameGUI ui)
      Create a new Replayer that is associated with a given Controller.

      Check whether or not a replayed game is currently being auto-replayed, or if it is replaying the actions in a step-by-step manner.

      Load a JSON file of a game replay and store it in the gameHistory queue.
      private void playTimer()
      Start/Resume the timer to automatically replay actions from a game recording.

      When in step-by-step replay mode, perform the next action.

      Set the replay speed for the recorded game to be replayed at.

      Stop the current timer from automatically replaying actions from a game recording.

      Switch between the "auto-replay" setting and the "step-by-step" setting for replaying games.

      • DEFAULT_DELAY_MILLIS

        public static final long DEFAULT_DELAY_MILLIS
        The period between two distinct timestamps in a game being replayed when the replay speed is 1.0x (only relevant while in auto-replay mode).
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

        public static final java.util.List<java.lang.Double> REPLAY_SPEEDS

    • Constructor Detail

      • Replayer

        public Replayer(GameGUI ui)
        Create a new Replayer that is associated with a given Controller.
        Parameters:
        ui - is the GUI associated with the game

    • Method Detail

      • getRecordingLevel

        public int getRecordingLevel()
        Get the level of the loaded game record.
        Returns:
        the level of the loaded game record, or -1 if no game is loaded

      • isAutoReplaying

        public boolean isAutoReplaying()
        Check whether or not a replayed game is currently being auto-replayed, or if it is replaying the actions in a step-by-step manner.
        Returns:
        true if auto-replaying, false if replaying step-by-step

      • getReplaySpeed

        public double getReplaySpeed()
        Get the currently set replay speed for replaying games.
        Returns:
        the replay speed

      • hasMovesToReplay

        public boolean hasMovesToReplay()
        Check whether there is a loaded game record that still has moves yet to be replayed.
        Returns:
        true if there is a loaded game record that has moves yet to be replayed false if there is no loaded game or all moves of a loaded game have been replayed

      • setReplaySpeed

        public void setReplaySpeed(double speed)
                    throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Set the replay speed for the recorded game to be replayed at. Only accepts speeds from replaySpeeds.
        Parameters:
        speed - is the new replay speed to set
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when an invalid speed value is given

      • getTimeBeforeNextMoveMillis

        public long getTimeBeforeNextMoveMillis()
        Get the time before the next move in a loaded game record.
        Returns:
        the time before the next move from the current time in the recording in milliseconds, or -1 if there is no loaded game

      • toggleReplayType

        public void toggleReplayType()
        Switch between the "auto-replay" setting and the "step-by-step" setting for replaying games. If switching to auto-replay mode, then start replaying actions at regular intervals. If switching to step-by-step mode, replay actions manually one at a time.

      • replayNextAction

        public double replayNextAction()
        When in step-by-step replay mode, perform the next action. Adjusts the current time in the replayed game to the recorded time that the action to replay was performed. Should only be called while in step-by-step mode. If in auto-replay mode, nothing will happen.
        Returns:
        the timestamp of the move that is replayed

      • stopTimer

        private void stopTimer()
        Stop the current timer from automatically replaying actions from a game recording.

      • playTimer

        private void playTimer()
        Start/Resume the timer to automatically replay actions from a game recording.

      • endCurrentReplay

        public void endCurrentReplay()
        Clear the queue of any loaded game record and stop replaying.

      • loadGameReplay

        public void loadGameReplay(java.io.File file)
                    throws java.io.IOException,
                           java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                           java.lang.NullPointerException,
                           com.google.gson.JsonSyntaxException
        Load a JSON file of a game replay and store it in the gameHistory queue.
        Parameters:
        file - is the name of the file to load
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - when an error occurs when reading the file
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when a file with an invalid filename is passed
        java.lang.NullPointerException - when there is no file passed
        com.google.gson.JsonSyntaxException - when there is an error parsing the JSON into ActionRecords
